content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # The regular expression pattern to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_pattern = r"```\s*julia\s*(.*?)\n```\s*"`"
    
    # Match all the Julia code blocks in the markdown document
    matches = eachmatch(julia_code_pattern, md)

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code blocks
    julia_code_blocks = ""

    # Iterate over the matches and append the code blocks to the `julia_code_blocks` variable
    for match in matches
        # Get the matched Julia code block
        julia_code_block = match.match
        
        # Remove code fences (``` characters) and join the code blocks together with a newline
        if !isnothing(julia_code_block)
            cleaned_code_block = replace(julia_code_block, r"^```\s*$" => "")
            julia_code_blocks *= cleaned_code_block * "\n"
        end
    end

    # Return the joined Julia code blocks as a string
    return julia_code_blocks
end
```
